message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static ArrayList<String> dataRead() throws FileNotFoundException {
    Scanner s = new Scanner(new File("c:\\stats.txt")).useDelimiter("\r");
    ArrayList<String> array = new ArrayList<String>();
    while(s.hasNext()) {
        String currentLine = s.next();
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(currentLine, "\t");
        while(st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            System.out.print(st.nextToken() + " ");
        }
        System.out.println("\r");
    }
    s.close();
    return array;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The NoSuchElementException is thrown because you are calling s.next() twice in your while loop. The first call is in the condition of the while loop and the second call is in the first line of the loop. Each call to next() advances the scanner past the next complete token, so if there are no more tokens, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. To avoid this, you should use the hasNext() method in the condition of the while loop. This method returns true if the scanner has another token in its input. This way, you will only call next() when you are sure that there is another token. Also, you should use StringTokenizer to split the current line into tokens, because it allows you to specify the delimiter.
